name: setting
content:
setting noun
(POSITION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C usually singular ] the position of a house or other building: Their house is in an idyllic country setting.
B2 [ C usually singular ] the time and the place in which the action of a book, film, play, etc. happens: The play has its setting in a wartime prison camp.
[ C ] a
place setting

More examplesFewer examplesThis would be the perfect setting for a wedding.The hotel itself is in an idyllic setting.The building is particularly notable for its garden setting.This is a tale of life and death in the idyllic rural setting of a 15th-century manor house.The movie casts a new light on the familiar Wild West setting.

setting noun
(CONTROLS)
[ C ] a position on the controls of a piece of equipment: My hairdryer has three settings - high, medium, and low.adjust a setting You don't need to adjust the setting every time you take a photo.
[ C ] one of the various functions of a mobile phone or other electronic device: Users are advised to change the setting by their phone companies, but not everybody does so. How do I change my display settings? See also
factory setting settings
[ plural ] the place on a mobile phone or other electronic device where you can set various functions: Go to Settings to connect to Wi-Fi networks.
